subject: Re: [junit] Beginner
msgSnippet: #: by Kent Beck s words the mind was *winged* :# ... I would say that from the point of view of a beginner the JUnit Pocket Guide is the book to start with.
messageBody:
#: by Kent Beck's words the mind was *winged* :#
> Priyanka,
>
> Erich's and my intention is that JUnit is not vast, but rather very
> approachable for programmers. For books I recommend JB's JUnit Recipes book
> or, for a brief (and cheap) introduction my JUnit Pocket Guide, available
> from O'Reilly.
>
> Good testing,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>

I would say that from the point of view of a beginner the JUnit Pocket Guide is the book to start
with. Than when you enter the details go for the Recipes. They will enlighten you ;-).

:alex
